channel.title: ScanX – Global
channel.description: Auto-generated feed for ScanX Global news

item.title: US Treasury Secretary Bessent Identifies AI as Primary Economic Growth Driver
item.description: Top News US Treasury Secretary Bessent Identifies AI as Primary Economic Growth Driver 1 hour ago US Treasury Secretary Bessent has identified artificial intelligence as the primary driver of future economic growth while addressing energy infrastructure implications and competitive dynamics. He stated that energy costs will stabilize near AI facilities and expressed confidence that the United States will extend its lead over China in what he termed a critical pass-or-fail AI competition.

item.title: iStreet Network Limited Board Approves Share Consolidation from ₹4 to ₹10 Face Value
item.description: iStreet Network Limited Board Approves Share Consolidation from ₹4 to ₹10 Face Value 9 hours ago iStreet Network Limited's Board of Directors approved a share consolidation plan on December 11, 2025, converting equity shares from ₹4.00 to ₹10.00 face value at a 5:2 ratio. The consolidation aims to align with industry standards, enhance capital structure stability, and improve institutional readiness. Subject to regulatory and shareholder approvals, the process is expected to complete within 3 months while maintaining the same authorized capital of ₹80.00 crores.

item.title: Nifty and Sensex Close in Green: Market Wrap for December 11, 2025
item.description: Nifty and Sensex Close in Green: Market Wrap for December 11, 2025 15 hours ago Indian stock markets ended positively on December 11, with Nifty 50 up 0.55% at 25,898.55 and Sensex rising 0.51% to 84,818.13. Market breadth was bullish with 2,597 advancing stocks out of 4,548 traded. Key buzzing stocks included InterGlobe Aviation, Biocon Biologics, and Kaynes Technology, driven by company-specific news and analyst actions.

item.title: Dynacons Systems & Solutions Secures ₹74.99 Crore Device-as-a-Service Project from Jammu Kashmir Bank
item.description: Dynacons Systems & Solutions Secures ₹74.99 Crore Device-as-a-Service Project from Jammu Kashmir Bank 7 hours ago Dynacons Systems & Solutions Limited has won a prestigious ₹74.99 crore Device-as-a-Service project from Jammu Kashmir Bank, formally disclosed through regulatory filing under SEBI Regulation 30. The five-year comprehensive digital workplace solution involves deploying 9,851 advanced desktops across 1,019 branches nationwide on an Opex-based model, covering the entire device lifecycle from procurement to e-waste management.
